remarks: If the predicate ` ch ( x , y ) ` is symmetric under interchange of ` x , y ` , then "without loss of generality" we can assume that ` x <_ y ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Aug-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Sep-2014.)
statement:
wlogle.1 $e |- ( ( z = x /\ w = y ) -> ( ps <-> ch ) ) $.
wlogle.2 $e |- ( ( z = y /\ w = x ) -> ( ps <-> th ) ) $.
wlogle.3 $e |- ( ph -> S C_ RR ) $.
wlogle.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ( ch <-> th ) ) $.
wlogle.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S /\ x <_ y ) ) -> ch ) $.
wlogle $p |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ch ) $.
$d S w x y z $.
$d ch w z $.
$d ph w x y z $.
$d ps x y $.
